actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to disallow any deduction for amounts paid or incurred for certain prescription-related advertisements, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to disallow a trade or business expense deduction for amounts paid or incurred with respect to prescription-related advertisements that have not been reviewed and approved by the Food and Drug Administration or a qualified nongovernmental review board. Denies tax-exemption to organizations that publish medical journals with such advertisements that have not been subject to such review and approval.

titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to disallow any deduction for amounts paid or incurred for certain prescription-related advertisements, and for other purposes.
